intro: Jurinea radians subsp. variabilis, commonly known as the variable sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This subspecies is typically found in coastal and saline environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant is adapted to harsh maritime conditions, exhibiting resilience to salt spray and strong winds. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal vegetation in its native range.
